title: Ticket #7680: condor_q -name useless for some hosts
description:
Mat reports: 

Got an issue: I've got a minicondor in a Docker container. The container's
hostname -f is  "c0a0000e013f". It's in the host file so ping resolves but when
I try to do condor_q -name `hostname -f` , I get Error: unknown host c0a0000e013f

After some analysis, it seems like the problem is that get_daemon_name() barfs when given a hostname that doesn't have a corresponding FQDN. Supposedly get_daemon_name() is only called by client code prior to doing a collector query, so that's the wrong behavior; clearly, the daemons do something something else. (Changing get_fqdn_from_hostname() seems likely to cause a lot of subtle issues, so let's avoid that.)

It's not clear what other side effects, if any, of this change would be, but Jaime points out that the following is absurd, and would be fixed by this change also: 

[jfrey@submit-1 ~]$ condor_status badname
condor_status: unknown host badname
[jfrey@submit-1 ~]$ condor_status badname.nogood
[jfrey@submit-1 ~]$
